explanation: Carl claims he was at the bar with his teammates after bowling until midnight. But Clue 3 shows his last bowling game ended at 9:34 PM, and the bar is forty minutes from the office. Yet Clue 2 shows his keycard was used to enter the parking garage at 11:47 PM â€” plenty of time to stop at a hardware store, drive to the office, and pour paint in the spot. Carl lied about going straight to the bar; he detoured to the office garage instead.
funFact: Reserved parking spots are so valued in some cities that they can add up to $50,000 to property values.
